item.title: Whitney add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Cleverness is a quality a man likes to have in his wife as long as she is some distance away from him. Up close, he'll take kindness any day of the week, if there's nothing more alluring to be had." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Henry James
Whitney add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Whitney add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "There are many things worth living for, a few things worth dying for, and nothing worth killing for." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didnâ€™t." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "You can only be young once. But you can always be immature." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "To keep your marriage brimming, with love in the wedding cup, whenever you're wrong, admit it; whenever you're right, shut up." -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Hold everything in your hands lightly, otherwise it hurts when God pries your fingers open." -- Corrie Ten Boom
